enb_long_title: Sixth Session of the Ad Hoc Group on the Berlin Mandate
sentences: Several AGBM participants commented on developments towards a common position regarding QELROs within one regional economic integration organization.
Despite its internal debate on burden sharing, agreement was reached on a common target.
Some delegates suggested that this common position could advance the entire AGBM process by sparking a transatlantic debate.
In contrast, others characterized the proposed target as 'unrealistic' and doubted it would be taken seriously.
One developing country delegate said the proposal could sharpen AGBMs focus on strengthening developed country commitments, while others noted that the targets timeframe greatly lessens its impact.
